title: Is Amazon Setting The Stage For Move Into Offline Retail?
teaser: Amazon has rolled out its own in-store credit card reader. Is this a step toward selling products in brick-and-mortar stores?
contentencoded:
Here’s a number that might surprise you: 85 to 95 percent of purchases still happen in the real world, not online. Less surprising is that Amazon is on a quest for a bigger cut of that market.

Earlier this month, the online retailer took a first, big step toward moving into the offline retail world: it rolled out its own in-store credit card reader, to compete with Square and other companies for the small business market.

Here & Now’s Sacha Pfeiffer talks to Jason Del Rey, senior editor for commerce at the tech news site Re/code, about Amazon’s plans to partner with brick-and-mortar stores around the country.
